general.text: It depends... but usually the answer is caching.
general.context: The universal truth of software development

general.text: Have you tried turning it off and on again? But for APIs.
There are only two hard things in computer science: cache invalidation and naming things... and off-by-one errors.
general.context: The eternal struggle of developers everywhere

ai.text: Most AI pilots don’t fail because of the tech; they fail because preparation never happened.
ai.context: Real world AI success depends on clarity of goals and readiness, not just models and demos.

ai.text: Start with the problem you want to solve; don’t start with the coolest model you can find.
ai.context: AI projects that lead with purpose outperform those that lead with hype.

ai.text: AI lowers the cost of mediocrity; it doesn’t raise the bar by itself.
ai.context: Cheap output isn’t the same as valuable output; tooling alone isn’t enough.

ai.text: AI isn’t a feature; it’s a system that has to be durable, maintainable, and accountable.
ai.context: Treat AI as long-term capability; avoid throwaway prototypes that vanish after the demo.

ai.text: Don’t treat autonomy as chaos; define clearly what happens when AI gets it wrong.
ai.context: Designing autonomous systems requires explicit rules for failure cases and oversight.

ai.text: Choosing the right custom model is about fit, not buzzwords.
ai.context: Use Azure Microsoft to connect models that are actually suitable for your use case.
